course.subject: PLSCS
course.course_title: Microbes, the Earth, and Everything

course.subject: PLSCS
course.course_title: Guided Explorations: Growing You and Your Path in the Agricultural Sciences

course.subject: PLSCS
course.course_title: Sustainable Agriculture: Food, Farming, and the Future

course.subject: PLSCS
course.course_title: Field Crop Systems

notes.note: Required for: Agriculture Science majors. Credit for both CSS 4050 and CSS 2110 (or CSS 3110) not permitted.

course.subject: PLSCS
course.course_title: Soil Science

course.subject: PLSCS
course.course_title: Introduction to Agricultural Machinery

notes.note: To enroll, contact Bob Schindelbeck (rrs3@cornell.edu). The dates and times of the four lecture periods will be determined during the first lab. Most labs will involve working with farm equipment or touring farm environments so students should wear boots or sturdy shoes and casual clothes.

course.subject: PLSCS
course.course_title: Weed Biology and Management

notes.note: Prerequisite: introductory course in biology or botany.

course.subject: PLSCS
course.course_title: Seed Science and Technology

notes.note: Prerequisite: BIOPL 2410 or equivalent

course.subject: PLSCS
course.course_title: Soil Genesis, Classification, and Survey

notes.note: Prerequisite: CSS 2600.

course.subject: PLSCS
course.course_title: Traditional Agriculture in Developing Nations

course.subject: PLSCS
course.course_title: Field Crop Systems

notes.note: Enrollment limited to: undergraduate and graduate students in the Crop Science, Plant Science, or International Agriculture curricula or by students in other majors and minors. Enrollment preference given to: advanced undergraduates and graduate students.

course.subject: PLSCS
course.course_title: Plant Responses to Environmental Stresses and Global Climate Change

notes.note: Prerequisites: BioPL2420, BioPL3420 or equivalent, BioPL3430 or equivalent, or permission of instructor

course.subject: PLSCS
course.course_title: Applied Remote Sensing and GIS for Resource Inventory and Analysis

course.subject: PLSCS
course.course_title: Tropical Cropping Systems: Biodiversity, Social, and Environmental Impacts

notes.note: Prerequisite: interest in agriculture and tropical cropping systems.

course.subject: PLSCS
course.course_title: The GMO Debate: Science and Society

notes.note: The department teaches trial courses under this number.

notes.note: Students from all colleges must submit a Special Studies Form (Available online: http://cals.cornell.edu/academics/registrar/policies/#special-studies). Do not sign into section 601. You will be put in the course after submitting form online.

course.course_title: Applied Plant-Microbe Interactions
